title: Camera And Case, Introduced 1972
provenance: Carole Krohn, Machine Age, Summerland, CA.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Neil Sellin
description: Camera open: Angular metal body, the triangular, hinged bellows and lens housing rising from flat rectangular base, and surmounted by angled view finder; tops of view finder and bellows housing covered in tan leather. Recessed circular lens, red shutter button, and other controls at front of housing. Base opens at front to accept film casette.  Camera closed: flat rectangular metal form surmounted by flat rhomboidal folded view finder cap; tops of view finder and housing covered in tan leather.

tombstone.epitaph:
Camera And Case, Introduced 1972.
Introduced 1972. Metal, plastic, leather. Museum purchase through gift of Neil Sellin. 1999-2-2-a,b.
